text: I am diving deeper into obc code right now, and I have an open question which I haven't got to yet - I see that the Membership Service is mandatory. Does this mean we are limited to blockchain who work in that model? could we replicate bitcoin on it (just to get a benchmark feeling)?
<@U0U55QLMT>: will the meetup be recorded? would love to see it

I'll miss out on the call tomorrow. I'd appreciate minutes if anyone has any! and i would actually appreciate some walkthroughs on how to get your hands on the code and play with it plus some ideas of what to try out when i have time... i found it hard to follow on from Tuesday's call and I had hoped to try something out, albeit remotely, this week
<@U0NM25NQ3> I agree that it appears that the obc Membership Service is intertwined all the way down to the consensus layer.
<@U0Q7KRNSJ>: to get an environment running, you can use the <https://github.com/hyperledger-incubator/obc-dev-env>
be sure to build your own base image, as we haven’t uploaded a hyperledger project-specific base image, yet
to do that, go into the baseimage directory and run 'make install'
then, cd to the parent directory and run the 'USE_LOCAL_BASEIMAGE=true vagrant up’ command to get the environment started, you then ssh in and then you can start playing, running tests etc
see <https://github.com/hyperledger-incubator/obc-peer> README.md for how to run tests, etc
if you run into difficulties, add issues so that we can improve (or better yet, submit pull request with suggested improvements/fixes)
Thanks <@U0KM61BCP> ! I'll be sure to do something about it if i hit stumbling blocks
